choices.B: Something forecast or currently not meeting specification
choices.C: A proposal for a change to a baseline
choices.A: An issue the Project Manager needs to resolve or escalate

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Ref Table 11.1

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the definition for an off-specification?
In which strategy would the change control process be recorded?

discussion.content: Configuration Management Strategy seems to be the in the older version of PRINCE2. In 2017 , Edition 6 this is called Change Control Approach.
This question is now invalid as per new syllabus as all strategies have been replaced by approaches.

questions.question_text: If the Project Board are too busy to authorize all change requests themselves they can appoint?

discussion.content: Answer should be A - see brochure page 142, 11.3.5
Change Authority can be called Change Committee.
Answer is A - clearly states this in delegating to a Change Authority (Ch 11.3.5).

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of a Product Status Account?

discussion.content: D is Correct see A.18.1 Product Status Account

choices.B: A log used to record problems or concerns about products
choices.C: An audit or review to compare actual status of products
choices.D: A report covering the status about the state of the projects products within
choices.A: A set of records that describe information about the project

discussion.content: Answer C is correct, see pg 144 of the manual - Impact analysis of an issue should consider: project performance targets, business case, dependent products produced by project, project risk profile

C

When examining a project issue in PRINCE2, the three aspects that should be considered are:

Business Case
Risk
Performance targets
Incorrect answer. An issue is when something has already occurred. Risk is something that hasn't occurred yet and might occur ( not certain). So C cannot be correct. More likely D is correct

questions.question_text:
When examining a project issue, which three aspects should be considered?
1. Performance targets
2. Business Case
3. Resources
4. Risk
